lesson: Unit 6 - Talking about Motivation and Ambition Quiz

questions.question: What is motivation?
answers: The drive to achieve a goal.
questions.correct: The drive to achieve a goal.

questions.question: Why is ambition important?
answers: It gives direction to your efforts.
It makes you forget your goals.
It allows you to do nothing.
questions.correct: It gives direction to your efforts.

questions.question: What can help you stay motivated when working towards a goal?
Which of these is an example of an ambitious goal?
answers: Learning a new language in a year.
questions.correct: Learning a new language in a year.

questions.question: Why is it helpful to write down your ambitions?
answers: It means you can forget them.
It means you can ignore them.

questions.question: Why is ambition linked to personal growth?
answers: It encourages you to learn and try new things.
It encourages you to stay in the same place.
questions.correct: It encourages you to learn and try new things.

questions.question: What is one way to stay motivated long term?
answers: Break big goals into smaller steps.
questions.correct: Break big goals into smaller steps.

questions.question: Why is it important to balance ambition with rest?
What can help maintain motivation in challenging times?
Why is it helpful to surround yourself with ambitious people?
answers: They can inspire and motivate you.
They can make you forget your goals.
They can slow down your progress.
questions.correct: They can inspire and motivate you.

questions.question: What is an example of a realistic ambition?
answers: Learning a new skill in 3 months.
Buying a house with no income.
questions.correct: Learning a new skill in 3 months.

questions.question: Why is it important to review your goals regularly?
answers: To measure progress and adjust when needed.
To stay in the same place.
questions.correct: To measure progress and adjust when needed.

questions.question: Why is self-discipline key to achieving ambitious goals?
answers: It ensures you stay focused despite challenges.
It means you can forget your goal.
It allows you to do nothing.
questions.correct: It ensures you stay focused despite challenges.

questions.question: Why is visualizing your goal helpful?
answers: It makes it feel more achievable.
It makes you forget about it.
questions.correct: It makes it feel more achievable.
